review: a game that captures your heart and mind
the best of the dawn of war series shit they are all pretty good but it gord 213 if you like 40k you will love this

this game makes me feel good
classic great game  one of the better 40k games made  great coop and pvp modes and great campaign

oh thats just all of dawn of war 2 in one package including all the shit dlc i bought relic where was this three years ago d oh the actual game is killer it plays like a slower more methodical game or a mad swarm depending on what you play  you get big stuff by playing well and retribution is the best mp and modding experience pm me when the elite dudes release their genestealer cult skin itll be siiiick

most finely portrayed 40k and mods so far  as of now elite mod is where most players are at one can find matches every 5 mins you may find prolific players with thousands of hours soaked in it  play the rich codex mod for 40k lore experience and lonely skirmishes with great ai  the last stand coop mode has players every few minutes or so
ive had this game years and never fails to hit that 3rd party kill kill kill time
detailed and very entertaining  long time fans of 40k will enjoy it

my introduction to the warhammer universe began with this game i still consider it one of the most enjoyable and atmospheric titles in the franchise even though it strays from the classic basebuilding rts mechanics its still a solid experience that said multiplayer isnt as fun without those mechanics unlike the main campaign

yea ive been playing this and yea pretty kinda cool i like it rbh i hope by buddy adam adn hayden get this and play it together or with me i think its cool landon penson and i have been playing it and i like it a lot
its a great game you will love it if you like the company of heroes series mixed with a lot of gritty scifi
one of the best coop campaigns that ive ever played
stomping around with giant armored warriors is pretty awesome stuff

i came in to this game pretty blind albeit with a rough idea of gameplay and the setting and was surprised at how it captured me there was enough tactical depth and variety to keep me entertained throughout the campaign and dlcs  with characters i cared about my only qualm was the repetitive and grindy bossfights which  whilst challenging  were not fun
what a journey as expected of wh40k  lore and storytelling can carry
still as great a game as it was when i first played it years ago

a very different take on rts than the original dawn of war and of course the third entry to this series was neither fish nor fowl and faceplanted upon release but i still had a good time playing through dow 2s campaign with its gear upgrades and narrative built around missions much more about using a few small squads to maximum effect as the old staples of rts macromanagement were largely jettisoned  obviously your mileage will vary depending on what kind of rts you are looking for
this game without games for windows live is a fucking beautiful thing
i love it when i use thaddeus and he constantly dies on me even when im mainly commanding his squad with the best squad and hes just dead 100 of the time also never knew 8bit ryan was in this game
it was fun and i really felt like a space marine captain commanding his troops
its like starcraft and warcraft together
i really like this game since it was released
good game more squad based then the first one but really nails the feel of the original dawn of war campaign
warhammer 40k there are no words for this masterpiece

very good story character personalities are distinct rpg progression style is on point missions are unique enough in my humble opinion not as memorable as dow1 or winter assult but still one of the greatest games of all time i finished the regular campaign but not the chaos rising i thought in that part you play as chaos not against it i will play and finish it this summer

if they just expanded the campaign  and changed nothing else about the game i would buy it for 20 bucks this game is the reason i first downloaded steam back when the things came on discs over 15 years ago beaten campaign on primarch difficulty with angel of death score and i still come back i wish there were other rts experiences similar to this one
properly some off the best and most fun rts still out there at least for multiplayer big community all considered 50 people in chat almost always etc
great control of units not massive armies but more tactical missions and strikes

it isnt perfect but if you like 40k you will probably enjoy it nice music and visuals gameplay is good but not incredible i highly recommend you play the campaigns on very hard otherwise they become a cakewalk very quickly on very hard they are challenging up until the lategame where if you built your characters properly you are godlike  if they had just made a hybrid of this and the original dawn of war then dawn of war 3 would have succeeded
amazing game a real shame the fandom has forgotten about it

the sheer ludicrousness of the setting goes hand in hand with reasonably well implemented game mechanics that are both easy to pick up and provide sufficient tactical depth  the downsides the missions of the single player campaign get very repetitive after a while often taking place on the exact same maps while multiplayer games require tons of micromanagement on the players part  still highly enjoyable

a huge departure from its predecessorlegacy and yet a rare case of something pretty good coming to light as a result definitely worth one or two playthroughs for any rts fans whether solo or coop could have done without the loot rng to be fair
excellent rts survival tactical shooter for the empire

the best warhammer 40k game ive ever played i finished the base game multiple times that good chaos rising is also great
